DataElement.preferredName: Patient Paclitaxel Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether the patient has a medical history of an hypersensitivity, an exaggerated response by the immune system to paclitaxel, a compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Paclitaxel Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's personal medical history of hypersensitivity, an exaggerated response by the immune system to paclitaxel, a compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity.  Paclitaxel binds to tubulin and inhibits the disassembly of microtubules, thereby resulting in the inhibition of cell division.  This agent also induces apoptosis by binding to and blocking the function of the apoptosis inhibitor protein Bcl-2 (B-cell Leukemia 2). (NCI04):An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A compound extracted from the Pacific yew tree Taxus brevifolia with antineoplastic activity.  Paclitaxel binds to tubulin and inhibits the disassembly of microtubules, thereby resulting in the inhibition of cell division.  This agent also induces apoptosis by binding to and blocking the function of the apoptosis inhibitor protein Bcl-2 (B-cell Leukemia 2). (NCI04)
An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions to carboplatin and/or paclitaxel or chemically similar compounds?

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
